newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico's Consorcio Hogar launches IPO.
newsitem.headline: Mexico's Consorcio Hogar launches IPO.

text.p: Mexican builder Consorcio Hogar SA completed an initial public offering of 11.63 million B class, or common shares, on the Mexican bourse on Friday, stock traders said.

The company had offered a total of 21.74 million shares, or 35.176 percent of its total capital, in both the Mexican and U.S. markets, according to newspaper advertisements from the firm published on Friday.
The U.S. offer was made through American Depositary Shares, subject to 144-A and S rules, the firm said.
Mexican brokerage Inverlat acted as leader in the IPO.
Hogar shares closed on Friday at their issue price of 10.40 pesos, and a total of 21.5 million shares changed hands.
((--Tomas de la Rosa, Mexico City newsroom +525 728-7912))
